learning_objectives: Compare fractions with the same denominator
Add fractions with the same denominator
common_misconceptions: Adding fractions by adding numerators and denominators separately
guidelines.teaching_approach: Use visual models (pizza, pie charts) before abstract notation. Start with concrete examples and gradually move to symbolic representation.

steps.content_hint: Introduce fractions as parts of a whole using pizza analogy. If you have a pizza cut into 4 equal slices and eat 1, you've eaten 1/4 of the pizza.
Explain numerator (how many pieces you have) and denominator (total pieces the whole is divided into). Top number = what you have, bottom number = total parts.
When fractions have the same denominator, compare numerators. Like comparing slices from the same pizza - more slices = bigger fraction.
To add fractions with the same denominator, add the numerators and keep the denominator. Like combining pizza slices - 2/8 + 3/8 = 5/8.
